itemDescription: Chief minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands (born 1951)

wikipedia_page.main:
Derek Hugh Taylor (born 1 October 1951) was Chief Minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands from 31 January 1995 to 15 August 2004. He is the former leader of the People's Democratic Movement (PDM) party.
He was re-elected to the Turks and Caicos Islands House of Assembly as an at-large member in the 2012 general elections but later lost his seat in the 2021 general elections as he didn't make it into the top 5 At-Large, as received the 9th most votes with 2,352 votes.

response: In the 2016 elections, Rufus Ewing's Progressive National Party (PNP) lost for the first time since they replaced Derek Hugh Taylor's government in 2003. The People's Democratic Movement (PDM) came to power with Sharlene Cartwright-Robinson as Premier. She was replaced by Washington Misick after the Progressive National Party won the 2021 general elections.
**#Derek Hugh Taylor, Chief Minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands (1995–2003)

*Derek Hugh Taylor (born 1951), Chief Minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands from 1995 to 2003

link_mentions.page: 2003 Turks and Caicos Islands general election
response: General elections were held in the Turks and Caicos Islands on 24 April 2003.General Election Results - 24 April 2003 Caribbean Elections The result was initially a victory for the ruling People's Democratic Movement (PDM), which won seven of the thirteen seats in the Legislative Council, with PDM leader Derek Hugh Taylor remaining Chief Minister. However, a court order resulted in the results in South Caicos North (won by the PDM's Noel Skippings by two votes) and Five Cays Providenciales (won by the PDM's Sean Astwood by five votes) being annulled. The opposition PNP won both seats in the subsequent by-elections and subsequently formed a government in August with Michael Misick becoming Chief Minister.
*Derek Hugh Taylor (born 1951), Chief Minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands, 1995–2003

link_mentions.page: 2016 Turks and Caicos Islands general election
1995 Turks and Caicos Islands general election
response: General elections were held in the Turks and Caicos Islands on 2 February 1995.General Election Results - 2 February 1995 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the opposition People's Democratic Movement (PDM), which won eight of the thirteen seats in the Legislative Council. Following the elections, PDM leader Derek Hugh Taylor became Chief Minister.

link_mentions.page: 1999 Turks and Caicos Islands general election
response: General elections were held in the Turks and Caicos Islands on 4 March 1999.General Election Results - 4 March 1999 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the ruling People's Democratic Movement (PDM), which won nine of the thirteen seats in the Legislative Council. PDM leader Derek Hugh Taylor remained Chief Minister.
